title: Gerimed Mobility
overview: Gerimed Mobility, your one-stop medical supply shop. Having been in operation for a few years, it was time for them to go live. Needing both an online shop and a design matching their branding efforts.

outline.goal: To provide their customers with the ability to view their products and place orders online with ease.
outline.scope: They needed an admin panel and a store-front for both customers and staff members.
outline.industry: Gerimed Mobility supplies its regional area with all their medical needs. From hospital-beds to personal hygiene products.

challenges.title: Branding efforts
content: Gerimed Mobility has a third-party designer, and I had to make sure the design matched their branding efforts while still keeping it UX/UI friendly.
I had some liberty in design choices but kept them to a minimum while focusing on the online shop's functionality.

challenges.title: Online Shopping
content: Since the entire website was custom and the back-end semi-custom, I opted for a custom shopping cart and implemented the order management from the ground up.
Users can register and login to their accounts to view all their past orders or track their current orders if they have the reference.

challenges.title: Admin Managment
content: Having an extensive product catalogue, the staff needed to manage the online shop's products and content.
I used Strapi with a few custom plugins to allow staff to manage their customers' orders, inventory, and promotions.

conclusion: When starting with this project, I decided to build most of the platform from the ground-up, but I ended up using Strapi for the back-end with a few custom plugins due to time constraint. However, the project proved to be quite manageable.

Since most of the back-end was complete, I mostly had to focus on architecting the front-end. I ended up trying to use the MVC architecture for the front-end; react being the View, Strapi the Model and state machines for the Controller. This allowed me to scale the platform while keeping a sound mind of where everything was and how it worked.
Gatsby provided me with various tools for; SEO, performance and accessibility. This allowed me to focus on more thought-provoking tasks, like cart functionality and order management.
All-in-all the project broadened my knowledge on numerous aspects of large scale projects, and it expanded my ability to work on said projects.
